summary:
Highly motivated and responsible tumor immunologist (PhD, SMBWO certified) and project manager (IPMA Level D certified). 

Starting in fundamental science, I obtained my PhD on investigating the role of Th17 cells in cervical cancer (LUMC). I moved to translational research with a postdoc on resistance mechanisms to immunotherapy in melanoma (MD Anderson Cancer Center). Switching to clinical research, I managed the setup of an international Leukemia Target Board for pediatric cancer patients with the aim to increase targeted therapy referral rates (Princess Máxima Center). I currently manage the organization of three cell and gene therapy projects in the group of dr. Trudy Straetemans, dr. Zsolt Sebestyén and prof. Jürgen Kuball: DARE-NL, Oncode-PACT cell and gene therapy workstream and ICAT GMPsim (UMCU).

I have (co-)led several organizations, among which LUMC PhD day, NatureJobs Texas Life Sciences Career Event and the Houston Postdoc Association. I am a team player, enjoy being challenged, communicate easily and have very broad interests.

profile_positions.description:
Managing the Dutch platform for advanced therapy medicinal product (ATMP) cancer research (DARE-NL) led by Dr. Trudy Straetemans. DARE-NL aims to harmonise the development, clinical testing and sustained patient access of oncological ATMPs. 

As a spider in the web, I manage milestones, finances, timing and risks within and between teams, set up and implement communication plans, organise documentation, write and share progress reports, organise the annual consortium meeting and aid in setting up a sustainable infrastructure.

Together with Emma Martinez Sanchez, I am creating an overview of the cell and gene therapy projects in the group of prof. Jürgen Kuball, dr. Trudy Straetemans, dr. Zsolt Sebestyén and dr. Dennis Beringer, including Oncode Accelerator and the Innovation Center for Advanced Therapies (ICAT), a pilot infrastructure for advanced therapies.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Cell and Gene Therapy projects

profile_positions.description: Setup of the international Leukemia Target Board as part of the Hemato-Oncology Precision Medicine program in the group of Prof. Monique den Boer. Together with project coordinator Uri Ilan, I managed the writing and approval process of the study protocol and governance document, patient information and involvement, building of the database, organisation of stakeholder meetings and workshops, communication, legal affairs, contracting, grant applications, planning and reporting.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager international Leukemia Target Board

profile_positions.description: Validated T cell gene knockouts (hits obtained from the screens) to improve immunotherapy efficacy; investigated signaling mechanisms.
profile_positions.title: Instructor

profile_positions.description: Under the supervision of Prof. Patrick Hwu, I aimed to improve immunotherapy by targeting the cellular metabolism in cancer and cytotoxic T cells. My main focus was on using pooled shRNA and gRNA libraries to identify metabolic genes that induce resistance to T cell induced cytotoxicity.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist

profile_positions.description: The MD Anderson Postdoctoral Association (PDA) is comprised of and led by postdoctoral fellows with the goals of improving, enhancing and enriching the experience of the 600 postdocs employed at MD Anderson. My co-chair and I led the executive committee teams, with the guidance of project director Dr. Victoria McDonnell as well as faculty mentors. I worked with education, administration and communication professionals to improve postdoctoral training programs.
profile_positions.title: Co-Chair  |  Postdoc Association Executive Committee
Team leader  |  Community Engagement, Postdoc Association Executive Committee
Chair  |  Communications subcommittee, Postdoc Association Executive Committee
Vice Chair  |  Career Development subcommittee, Postdoc Association Executive Committee

profile_positions.description: The Association for Women in Science (AWIS) is a leading organization that advocates for the interests of women in science and technology.
profile_positions.title: Member | Public Relations subcommittee, AWIS

profile_positions.description:
The Houston Postdoctoral Alliance (HPDA) supports postdoctoral research fellows working in Houston, Texas and surrounding areas by providing networks, career development opportunities and advocacy supplementing the institute’s postdoctoral associations. This is meant to create a sense of community and collaboration for postdoctoral scientists in Houston. 
As the founder and President of the HPDA, I created a fantastic executive team of highly motivated cross-institutional postdocs. I develop the strategy, and organized 2 very successful initiating career-development events in 2019. We are now starting to collaborate with the Texas Medical Center (TMC) to expand our representation, advocacy and ability to organize career-related events, training and policies to benefit all postdocs in the Houston area.
profile_positions.title: Chair | Houston PostDoctoral Alliance

profile_positions.description: Postdoctoral fellows from various graduate programs meet to identify core resources and collaborators, create a framework for representation on campus and in the local community and foster a sense of innovation.
profile_positions.title: Member  |  Texas Medical Center Postdoctoral Research Council

company.name: The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center UTHealth Graduate School of Biomedical Sciences

profile_positions.company: The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center UTHealth Graduate School of Biomedical Sciences
profile_positions.description: Initiated by Dr. Sina Safayi, I co-chaired the organizing committee of the first career expo of its kind in Houston, Texas. We collaborated with NatureJobs to make this into a successful event.
profile_positions.title: Co-chair  |  NatureJobs Career Expo Texas Organizing Committee

profile_positions.description: As a board member of the LUMC Association for PhD candidates (LAP), I communicated the needs of PhD candidates between PhD candidates and the faculty dean. In addition, I organized the LUMC PhD day in 2013, co-organized lectures and was involved with the Graduate School committee.
profile_positions.title: Board member  |  LUMC Association for PhD candidates (LAP)

profile_positions.description:
Tumorimmunology PhD project on the role of Th17 cells in cervical cancer.

Under the supervision of Dr. Arko Gorter, Dr. Katja Jordanova and Prof. Gert Jan Fleuren, I studied the role of Th17 cells using immunohistochemistry, immunofluorescence, brightfield confocal and spectral microscopy, in vitro cancer cell and neutrophil studies, qRT-PCR, FACS cell sorting and analysis, totRNA-seq, RNA ISH and statistical analysis of these and clinical data.
profile_positions.title: PhD Pathology

profile_positions.description: After my internship at TNO, I worked here as a research analyst for three months. The work mainly involved cell culture, transfection, Western blot and HPLC.
profile_positions.title: Research analyst

profile_positions.description: My graduation internship was performed at the department of Tissue Repair under the supervision of Dr. Reinout Stoop. For this project on collagen cross-link maturation, I used both ex vivo and in vitro material, HPLC and colorimetric assays to study the characteristics of collagen.
profile_positions.title: Master student intern

profile_positions.description: Market analysis project for the company QuickZyme, founded by Dr. Roeland Hanemaaijer and Dr. Jan Verheijen. This project, which was focused on a kit to measure MMP-9, provided me with a broader knowledge and orientation in the scientific field.
profile_positions.title: Market analysis project
